It is a supporting function used during import analysis to correctly interpret imports that use leading dots.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"525887a2-96fd-4f3f-ae42-3522a9839e72","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Purpose","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"74d8ff27-9ce4-4a81-a7d1-1752b482db22","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Python allows relative imports such as ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"from . import x","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" or ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"from ..subpackage import y","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":". This function translates those relative references into a form that Python’s import machinery—and the import analysis system—can work with safely and consistently.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"d2662a1f-1a56-41ac-93e7-2fe448b91a5f","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"04987039-8394-479e-8a39-c5a3b28c0ae0","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":2,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"What Summary","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"52433edd-e9ba-443a-931f-ccd2748a008c","type":"codeBlock","props":{"language":"javascript"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Input:
  name  → module name being imported
  level → relative import depth (number of dots)

Process:
  1. Determine current package context
  2. Validate import level
  3. Construct relative module name
  4. Adjust package context (special case: __init__.py)
  5. Return resolved name and package

Output:
  (mod_name, package)","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"3d525ad0-40f7-4ee3-a148-c3d79286cea7","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"7eeb2492-9822-4069-beb7-c0bb4d37bffd","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":2,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Special Cases Handled","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"38772fa2-3360-4eb6-a7f6-cfca8c5bc703","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Import Beyond Package Root","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"85e438bc-fb53-443c-a6a3-72456424f990","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"If the relative import attempts to go higher than the top-level package, the function raises an ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ImportError","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":". This prevents invalid or ambiguous imports from being processed.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"68582a95-3603-4340-a6a5-b86f09b62903","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"fc6e077a-4746-4af9-a88f-d7506473ef90","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"__init__.py","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Files","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"cbf0dbf9-7856-4237-a3d9-a53c09ed61bd","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Imports inside ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"__init__.py","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" behave slightly differently because the module name does not explicitly include ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"__init__","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".
